A. Robinson, Ipswich, Massachusetts |Ship original cost= |Ship laid down=23 July 1944 |Ship launched= 4 October 1944 |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= 9 January 1945 |Ship out of service= 1957 |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= YTB-218, 15 May 1944 |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport= |Ship identification= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship captured= |Ship fate= Fate unknown |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=''Cahto''-class district harbor tug |Ship displacement={{convert|410|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} |Ship length= {{convert|110|ft|0|in|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|27|ft|0|in|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|11|ft|4|in|abbr=on}} |Ship power= |Ship propulsion= |Ship speed= {{convert|12|kn|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship complement= 12 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=2 Ã— .50-caliber [[machine gun]]s |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Achigan'' (YT-218/YTB-218)''' was a [[Cahto class harbor tug|''Cahto''-class]] [[tugboat|large harbor tug]] in the service of the [[United States Navy]]. She was laid down as ''Achigan'' (YT-218) on 23 July 1943 at [[Ipswich, Massachusetts]] by [[W. A. Robinson]], reclassified YTB-218 on 15 May 1944, launched on 4 October 1944, and placed in service on 9 January 1945. ==Service history== Assigned to the [[4th Naval District]], ''Achigan'' spent most of her naval career at the [[Philadelphia Naval Shipyard]]. On the afternoon of 8 January 1946, she sank at Philadelphia as a result of a collision with {{USS|General J. C. Breckinridge|AP-176|3}}. Later salvaged, the tug returned to service at Philadelphia in mid-1947. ''Achigan'' served there until the summer of 1956 when she was transferred to the [[6th Naval District]]. The meager record of her service indicates that the tug served in the 6th Naval District into 1957 and was disposed of later that year. == References == {{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/a2/achigan.htm}} {{Cahto class tug}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Achigan}} [[Category:Tugs of the United States Navy]] [[Category:Ships built in Massachusetts]] [[Category:1944 ships]]
